explanation: To determine whether add_new_users violates the MISRA rule banning direct or indirect self-calls, you must inspect every function reachable from add_new_users to see if any path returns to add_new_users. add_new_user_entry: the direct callee of add_new_users — its body and call sites must be examined to see whether it (directly or indirectly) calls add_new_users. MHD_digest_auth_calc_userhash and MHD_digest_auth_calc_userdigest: these are callees of add_new_user_entry according to the static call graph; their bodies (and any functions they call) must be checked to ensure they do not call back into add_new_user_entry or add_new_users (i.e., create an indirect recursion). No other symbols from add_new_users (e.g., REALM, literal arguments) affect recursion, so they are not required for this particular MISRA rule check.
